title: Welcome
description: Welcome to the HAXsite for CYBER 362, Section 002! This course teaches fundamental data-driven cybersecurity analytics skills with Python, Splunk, and other tools. In particular, students will learn
text:
welcome to the haxsite for cyber 362, section 002! this course teaches fundamental data-driven cybersecurity analytics skills with python, splunk, and other tools. in particular, students will learn how handle large quantities of "dirty" real-world data. visit here info, lab instructions, guides on tools like python vs code!
scheduled lectures
class meetings occur twice per week tuesdays thursdays from 1:35 pm 2:50 pm. 002 is a remote, synchronous all zoom.

title: CLI Crash Course
text:
navigating the command line
the line interface (cli), or terminal, is a powerful, text-based environment for interacting with your computer. cli tools are extremely common in it industry across development, cybersecurity, and more. has remained core component of every major operating system decades. becoming familiar such will be an incredibly valuable, long-lasting skill. although you may not term cli, youve likely heard some following software (which all clis!):
windows: prompt, powershell



macos: terminal



linux: konsole, gnome console




the most action that you'll perform 1. moving between folders 2. listing folder contents.
1. folders
to move folders, use the cd command. this same available on system. cd short "change directory." entering by itself (with no other text) automatically bring back to home (/home/<username> macos/linux, c:\users\<username> windows). can another pwd confirm where you're located. "print working directory."
$ represent separate lines terminal commands.
$ cd

$ pwd
/home/exampleuser
when specific location, relative path absolute path. path starts looking target from current folder. means don't need fill file (think as the folder sequence) above full sequence takes start hard drive (/ on c: windows) targeted folder.
$ ./documents 
$ pwd
/home/exampleuser/documents

$ documents /home/exampleuser/documents pwd
/home/exampleuser/documents
sometimes return location. go backwards without typing path, accepts characters (../) symbolize "return up once."
$ ../ pwd
/home/exampleuser

$ ../../ pwd
/home
2. contents
to list contents, either ls macos/linux dir windows. "list," while "directory." certain emulate windows (git bash example), if desired. these commands both provide simple visible files subfolders at location.
$ 
desktop/  downloads/ pictures/ videos/
documents/ music/ public/

$ 
 volume c label.
 serial number a1b2-c3d4

 directory c:\users\exampleuser

09/02/2025 04:50 am .
09/02/2025 ..
08/29/2025 08:30 desktop
09/01/2025 02:00 pm documents
09/02/2025 09:30 downloads
08/29/2025 pictures
08/29/2025 public
08/29/2025 templates
08/29/2025 videos
 0 file(s) bytes
 9 dir(s) 400,000,000,000 bytes free
sometimes view hidden find detailed information like size. achieved something called flag. many allow pass special options change behaviors. 
for command, correct would -lsa. /a /q. each makes request more advanced output.
$ -lsa
total 52
 drwx------. 1 exampleuser 596 aug 29 13:25 ./
 drwxr-xr-x. root 14 jun 21 23:39 ../
20 -rw-------. 18542 12:44 .bash_history
 4 -rw-r--r--. 18 20 08:40 .bash_logout
 144 .bash_profile
 617 jul 3 08:14 .bashrc
 738 .cache/
 802 .config/

 6788 12:35 documents/

$ /q /a
 nt authority\system junction desktop-abc123\exampleuser appdata
08/29/2025 pictures

title: Windows Setup
text:
please review the following documentation for installing and configuring python, anaconda, vs code on your windows 10/11 device.
install python
visit official python foundation website: python.org













select download installer (64-bit)













select python-3.13.7-amd64.exe from your downloads folder in file explorer









important: select checkbox add python.exe to path, this allows terminal use standard python command









select install now









open either command prompt or powershell start menu









test by entering python --version









if version number appears, then has been successfully installed!














install conda
visit anaconda anaconda.com, skip registration








select 64-bit graphical under - 3.13








select miniconda3-latest-windows-x86_64.exe explorer








select just me (recommended) during installation type step
select my path environment variable advanced options step







complete remaining miniconda steps with default options







open prompt menu







test conda entering --version






if installed!










install configure code
visit visual studio code.visualstudio.com








select download windows








select vscodeusersetup-x64-1.103.2.exe downloads explorer





important: "open code" action explorer directory context menu, you open folders directly explorer




complete setup options



open menu



select extensions icon left sidebar, search marketplace



install extension pack



search jupyter marketplace, pack







test notebooks
open run as administrator option



enter set-executionpolicy -scope currentuser remotesigned, environments



create a cyber 362 store assignments (suggestion: documents/cyber362), folder



create temporary named test.py in folder, enter text print("hello world!") and save file



select run button



if everything was installed successfully, hello world! message will appear terminal!



now lets test with conda! close current window, 3.13 (64-bit) button at bottom right of code



select base (3.13.5) environment, change interpreter that is using



select > new terminal, verify that automatically runs conda activate base in window



enter jupyter to all necessary packages using notebooks



enter numpy matplotlib pandas additional future assignments


create another test.ipynb, notebooks



select kernel side notebook, environments



select (python 3.13.5) env



select + button, world!") into notebook cell



if installed, below!

title: macOS Setup
text:
please review the following documentation for installing and configuring python, anaconda, vs code on your macos device.
install python
download python from official site: python.org





select download 64-bit universal installer





select python-3.13.7-macos11.pkg downloads folder in finder




complete install dialogue with default options




visit /applications/python 3.13/ folder finder




run script file install certificates.command




open terminal




test by entering --version




if version number appears, then has been successfully installed!






install conda
visit anaconda website: anaconda.com, select skip registration




select (apple silicon) graphical installer  or 64-bite (intel chip) under mac - 3.13, correct option depends macbook model




select miniconda3-latest-macosx-<model type>.pkg iin miniconda3 20205.06-1 dialogue default options




open conda installed!

install configure code
visit visual studio code.visualstudio.com




visit page, 11.0+



select vscode-darwin-universal.zip finder



when zip file uncompresses, move code.app to applications folder



open double-clicking .app file, pin dock



in code, open command palette (cmd+shift+p)



enter shell command, command: code' path



select extensions icon left sidebar, search marketplace



install extension pack



search jupyter marketplace, pack






test notebooks
create a cyber 362 store assignments finder (suggestion: documents/cyber362), this folder


create temporary named test.py folder, enter text print("hello world!") save file


select run button


if everything was installed successfully, hello world! message will appear terminal!


now let's test conda! close current terminal window, 3.13 button at bottom right of code


select base (3.13.5) environment, change interpreter that is using


select > new terminal, verify automatically runs activate window


enter all necessary packages using notebooks


enter numpy matplotlib pandas additional future assignments

create another test.ipynb, notebooks


select kernel side notebook, environments


select (python 3.13.5) env


select + button, into notebook cell


if installed, below!

title: GenAI for Coding
text:
please review the following documentation for installing and configuring github copilot coding assistant to your vs code application.
install copilot
open visual studio from start menu
select extensions icon on left sidebar, then search copilot in marketplace
install copilot extension pack
select bottom status bar, select set up copilot
select continue with as sign-in method, enter your account credentials
if you do not have a account, create one at: github.com

vs code will automatically open new chat menu right side of screen. is now successfully installed!

unlock pro
the base version copilot severely limits usage rate, available models, experimental features users. luckily, college students are granted free access to pro subscription through student developer pack program.
visit official github education website: education.github.com/pack
follow registration steps education, will be asked submit an image physical penn state id
wait few days application reviewed
if receive welcome email, been pack
visit website again, there long list affiliated benefits
select get direct under all offers > about copilot
follow activation copilot
if used same login code, pro activated!

title: Wireshark
description:
This article serves as a gentle introduction to Wireshark for Lab 5. Network-traffic-analysis1.pcap will serve as the example file for this tutorial.
Wireshark Interface
Wireshark’s main i
text:
this article serves as a gentle introduction to wireshark for lab 5. network-traffic-analysis1.pcap will serve the example file tutorial.
wireshark interface
wireshark’s main interface is divided into three primary panes:
packet list pane (top pane): displays summary of each captured packet — including number, timestamp, source, destination, protocol, length, and info.  line represents one packet. when you click on here, other panes show details about it. 


packet (middle or left shows decoded, hierarchical breakdown selected can expand protocol layers (ethernet, ip, tcp, http, etc.) see specific fields values. 


packet bytes (bottom right raw data in hexadecimal ascii format. highlighting field middle also highlights corresponding here.



q1. how find mac address client? 
in display filter bar type: ip.addr == 192.168.2.147
click any that involves ipin ethernet ii. source destination addresses. if from windows client, its mac; itâs mac.



q2. how host name client?
there are two methods follow.
method 1:
in bootp
look dhcp request inform clientâs ip (for example, 192.168.2.147)click packet, then expand: dynamic configuration (inform)expand option 12: â value shown hostname.

method 2:
open edit â preferences appearance columns, add (+), configure new column with following settings: title: cnamestring, custom, fields: kerberos.cnamestring. apply ok save;in bar, enter kerberos.cnamestring kerberos packets containing client string field. active directory environments, note hostnames (machine accounts) end $, while user accounts do not.
to only names, use filter: (kerberos.cnamestring contains $')


q3. account client?
open !(kerberos.cnamestring '$')


q4. how url returned an executable file/jpg file/png file?
open media, media. http
look media label âââ packet;in hypertext transfer protocol; full we looking for.

q5. how date time happen?
follow q4, protocol
date listed, figure q4.

q6. size (bytes) file?
follow type
content length represent file, q4.

q7. out tcp connection?
find http response delivered .exe q4; frame number time;apply all connections after moment: tcp.flags.syn 1 && ip.src 192.168.2.147
this outgoing syn (connection attempts) initiated by infected host. check ensure first number/time response.click internet version 4. thatâs tried connect infection.

title: Splunk
text:
please review the following documentation to access and learn about splunk siem platform at penn state. this will assist you in preparing for lab 6.
how splunk
the college of ist hosts its own instance enterprise address splunk.ist.psu.edu. however, is restricted can only be accessed from state networks psu or eduroam authenticate. students may simply visit splunk.ist.psu.edu from computer labs their devices while on-campus. 
if would like access splunk.ist.psu.edu remotely, follow one two methods below. need choose approach. do not globalprotect vpn use winlabs, nor vice versa.
1. vpn
penn provides a free service remote connection secured university resources. by locally installing client, your network traffic encrypted, then safely routed server. correct it guide operating system below:
globalprotect windows


globalprotect macos


globalprotect linux



for more information on general, reference article:
globalprotect - overview



2. winlabs
the also free virtual desktop infrastructure (vdi) solution called winlabs. vdi virtual machine cluster that provisions full environment users. winlabs is browser-based platform, which chrome, firefox, other popular browsers.
to visit address winlabs.ist.psu.edu. instructed login with id password. (ex: wjw5326)

you now have network. information, resources:
connecting winlabs


ist classroom winlabs



logging into splunk
once are (from three above), screen will become visible. enter wjw5326, include @psu.edu) password.

after submitting credentials, gain dashboard.

splunk search tutorial

title: About HAX
text:
what is hax?
a radically simple approach to web authoring and content ownership. the goal of hax simple: help people create rich engaging without needing understand code.
hax an open-source ecosystem built right here at penn state! with vanilla javascript litelement on component standard. idea online should always be accessible, even as third-party frameworks age diverge.
this thriving community led by project lead bryan ollendyke faculty fellow dr. david fusco. involves a variety fields including programming (full stack), ui/ux design, data sciences/ai, learning education technology development, more.
getting involved?
hax looking for more bright minds, eager gain valuable skills contribute towards greater community. there are two main organizations state university park, lab and club.
hax lab: a research group focused open accessible technologies. lab collaboration between ist, arts architecture other partners empower educational student success through ecosystem. the everyone, regardless background!
hax club: student-led organization enthusiasts connected lab. club anyone interested in making mark open-source! weekly meetings thursdays at borland room 113!

learn hax.psu.edu and github.com/haxtheweb!

title: Syllabus
text:
course description
this three-credit studio teaches fundamental data-driven cybersecurity analytics skills using programming introduced in other courses (e.g., ist 140). the will be divided into five modules. 
the first module introduces analytics, as well recapping on some of the related security issues covered previous courses. the second gets students prepared for by gaining familiarity with data software tools  and platforms such python, siem, soar, etc. 
the third focuses understanding popular machine learning algorithms analytics.  the fourth how to apply processes methods selected problems anomaly detection, network traffic analysis, protecting consumer web internet-facing apis, deploying systems production environments. 
the team project is fifth module.  this course, improve their knowledge tools, methodologies, processes; them real-world problems.
objectives
the purpose provide become more efficient exploring, visualizing recognizing patterns that represent threats addressing them. upon completion able to:
understand justify needs applying and/or solving problems.understand analytical tools python tensorflow  solve problems.apply exploration visualization identify potential (such missing, outlier skewness data)prepare quality analytics.select, evaluate appropriate model real world etc.
assignments grading
course grading breakdown

	
		
			grading category
			percentage final grade
		

	

	
		
			labs
			40%
		

		
			team project
			20%
		

		
			exams
			10%
		

		
			homework assignments
			15%
		

		
			quizzes
			15%
		

		
			total
			100%

homework assignments quizzes are due sunday at 11:59 p.m. unless otherwise specified (see below). submit all homework via canvas.
please ensure your assignment looks professional, written professionally, communicates ideas clearly. writing should accurate diction, spelling, punctuation, grammar, sentence structure. points deducted not pay attention instructions.
